answers.answer: The most likely answer is no however you should see an ophthalmologist (and at least yearly the rest of your life) to see if glasses might help and to be sure you don't have intrinsic eye disease. Most cases the problem is damage to the nerve tracts to the brain behind the eye. Brain tissue does not regenerate like peripheral nerve tissue does. Protect your good eye from injury and lead a healthy lifestyle as diseases like high blood pressure and diabetes and tobacco use can damage your good eye.

question: Hello Doctor,4 years back I had Brain Tumor (Meningioma)  surgery. The tumor impacted by right eye vision.Now I am ok and do checkup every year. Before surgery the right eye vision was just 10-15 %.The left eye was perfect, however after surgery I lost 5 % vision on left eye, however the vision was improved in right eye a bit.Is there any way that I can re gain my lost vision in right eye?
title: Lost vison in right eye
